thread.title: Dario Franchitti discusses his concussion in case study video
thread.title_full: Dario Franchitti discusses his concussion in case study video

title: Dario Franchitti discusses his concussion in case study video
text:
Mar 6, 2017 at 1:43p ET 0Shares 
A new video by SAFEisFAST features four-time IndyCar Series champion Dario Franchitti and Dr. Steve Olvey talking about Franchitti’s concussion and his decision to retire. 
Franchitti was involved in a frightening last-lap collision during the final lap of the Grand Prix of Houston on Oct. 6, 2013 at Reliant Park in Houston, Texas. 
Franchitti suffered a large concussion in the incident as well as several fractured bones. One month later, the Scot made his decision to retire based off of advise given to him by Dr. Olvey, who is also a Road Racing Drivers Club member and Neurocritical Care Physician. 
SAFE is Fast’s video is a seven-minute long case study on concussions, where both Franchitti and Olvey share their experiences from a driver and a doctor’s perspective. 0
